That's a fantastic idea! Packing your own snacks can ensure you're fueling your body with healthy options, and it's often more cost-effective and convenient than relying on external sources. Here are some healthy snack ideas that are easy to prepare, won't spoil easily, and are perfect for your Sunday soccer games:

1. **Fresh Fruits**: Apples, oranges, bananas, grapes, or any other fruits that are in season. Fresh fruits are nutritious, easy to pack, and provide a natural energy boost.
2. **Nuts and Seeds**: Almonds, walnuts, cashews, pumpkin seeds, or trail mix are all great options. They're rich in healthy fats, protein, and fiber.
3. **Energy Balls**: Make your own energy balls with rolled oats, nuts, seeds, and dried fruits. They're easy to prepare, packed with nutrients, and don't require refrigeration.
4. **Jerky**: Beef, turkey, or chicken jerky is a convenient and protein-rich snack that's easy to pack. Look for low-sodium options or make your own at home.
5. **Dried Fruits and Veggies**: Dried apricots, cranberries, carrots, or sweet potato strips are healthy and lightweight. You can also dry your own fruits and veggies at home.
6. **Granola or Energy Bars**: Look for homemade or store-bought options that are low in added sugars and made with wholesome ingredients.
7. **Sandwiches or Wraps**: Prepare small sandwiches or wraps with whole-grain bread, lean meats, cheese, and veggies. They're easy to pack and provide a satisfying snack.
8. **Hard-Boiled Eggs**: Boil eggs on the weekend and keep them in the fridge for up to 5 days. They're a great source of protein and can be easily packed.
9. **Cottage Cheese or Greek Yogurt**: Pack individual containers of cottage cheese or Greek yogurt for a protein-rich snack that's easy to digest.
10. **Homemade Trail Mix**: Mix together nuts, seeds, and dried fruits for a healthy and customizable snack.

Remember to pack your snacks in reusable containers or bags to reduce waste and keep them fresh. You can also consider preparing snacks on the weekend and portioning them out for the week to save time.

Stay fueled, stay focused, and have a great game!
